results.title: A comparative study between myo-inositol and metformin in the treatment of insulin-resistant women.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: @CHEMICAL_Inositol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007294 @@@MYO@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@, associated with life-style, had both significant beneficial effects on serum progesterone and @GENE_PRL @GENE_5617 @@@prolactin@@@ levels, menstrual @<m>DISEASE_Urea_Cycle_Disorders_Inborn</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056806 @@@cycle disorders@@@ and pregnancy rates in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ without severe carbohydrate metabolism malfunctions.

citations.NLM: Nas K, Tűű L. A comparative study between myo-inositol and metformin in the treatment of insulin-resistant women. Eur Rev Med Pharmacol Sci. 2017 Jun;21(2 Suppl):77-82. PMID: 28724173
citations.BibTeX: @article{28724173, title={A comparative study between myo-inositol and metformin in the treatment of insulin-resistant women.}, author={Nas K and Tűű L}, journal={Eur Rev Med Pharmacol Sci}, volume={21}, number={2 Suppl}, pages={77-82}}

results.title: Metformin-induced stimulation of adenosine 5' monophosphate-activated protein kinase (PRKA) impairs progesterone secretion in rat granulosa cells.
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ is an anti-@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ drug commonly used to treat @<m>DISEASE_Urea_Cycle_Disorders_Inborn</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056806 @@@cycle disorders@@@ and @DISEASE_Anovulation @DISEASE_MESH:D000858 @@@anovulation@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@polycystic ovary syndrome@@@.

citations.NLM: Tosca L, Solnais P, Ferré P, Foufelle F, Dupont J. Metformin-induced stimulation of adenosine 5' monophosphate-activated protein kinase (PRKA) impairs progesterone secretion in rat granulosa cells. Biol Reprod. 2006 Sep;75(3):342-51. PMID: 16760380

results.title: Early effects of metformin in women with polycystic ovary syndrome: a prospective randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial.
results.text_hl: ...CONTEXT: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ is successfully used in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Urea_Cycle_Disorders_Inborn</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056806 @@@cycle disorders@@@ and @DISEASE_Anovulation @DISEASE_MESH:D000858 @@@anovulation@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@polycystic ovary syndrome@@@ (@DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@).

citations.NLM: Eisenhardt S, Schwarzmann N, Henschel V, Germeyer A, von Wolff M, Hamann A, Strowitzki T. Early effects of metformin in women with polycystic ovary syndrome: a prospective randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2006 Mar;91(3):946-52. PMID: 16352680
